alert.note: Alert for Caswell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:33PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Caswell County through 700 PM EDT... At 632 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Prospect Hill, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Yanceyville... Jericho... Prospect Hill... Leasburg... Topnot... Hightowers... and Baynes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for south central Virginia.
